WorkItem.Description:
if I pass in a literal numeric value that begins with a decimal point, the parser appears to not accept it.
 
For instance:
pi * .546
 
ciloci.Flee.ExpressionCompileException: Syntax Error: unexpected token ".", expected one of "-", <INTEGER>, <REAL>, <STRING_LITERAL>, "True", "False", <HEX_LITERAL>, <CHAR_LITERAL>, "null", "(", <IDENTIFIER>, "if", or "cast", on line: 1 column: 73 ---> PerCederberg.Grammatica.Runtime.ParserLogException: unexpected token ".", expected one of "-", <INTEGER>, <REAL>, <STRING_LITERAL>, "True", "False", <HEX_LITERAL>, <CHAR_LITERAL>, "null", "(", <IDENTIFIER>, "if", or "cast", on line: 1 column: 73
   at PerCederberg.Grammatica.Runtime.Parser.Parse()
 
if I use a leading zero, it works fine:
pi * 0.546
 
This is not TOO big of an issue, just thought I would throw it out there and see if the pre-parser could automatically put the zero before passing to the tokenizer. if not, I can do it myself before handing it off to the expression.
 
Noel
